dus dus

ind. a prefix to nouns and rarely to verbs or adverbs (Pāṇ. 2-1 , 6 ; 2 , 18 VArtt. 2 Pat. ; iii , 3 , 126 &c.) implying evil , bad , difficult , hard Page'88,2 488,1 L=94676

dus dus

ind. badly , hardly ; slight , inferior &c. (opp. to su) , often = Engl. in- or un- [cf. √ 2. duS ; Zd. dush- ; Gk. $ ; Goth. tuz- ; O.H.G. zur.]. It becomes dur (q.v.) before vowels and soft consonants 488,2 L=94676.1

dus dus

ind. dU (q.v.) before r and sometimes before d dh n , which become D Dh N 488,2 L=94676.2

dus dus

ind. remains unchanged before t , th (in older language however ST , STh) 488,2 L=94676.3

dus dus

ind. becomes duS (q.v.) , rarely duH before k , kh ; p , ph 488,2 L=94676.4

dus dus

ind. duz (q.v.) before c ch 488,2 L=94676.5

Ragh. vii , 47 Rit. i , 27] esp. after a word denoting a country or a part of the body e.g. kAmboja- magadha- ; aMsa- kaNTha- skandha- ; AtmIya- , one's own country or home) 496,2 L=96522

dvIpa dvIpa'

mn. a division of the terrestrial world (either 7 [Jambu , Plaksha or Go-medaka , ZAlmalI , Kuza , KrauJca , ZAka and Pushkara MBh. vi , 604 &c. Hariv. Pur. &c.] or 4 [Bhadra^zva , Ketu-mAla , Jambu-dvIpa and UttarAH KuravaH MBh. vi , 208 Hariv. Kāv. &c. cf. Dharmas. cxx] or 13 [the latter four + 9 , viz. Indra-dvIpa , KazerU-mat , TAmra-varNa , Gabhasti-mat , NAga-dvIpa , Saumya , GAndharva , VaruNa and BhArata , which are enumerated VP. ii , 3 , 6 ; 7, as forming BhArata-varsha] or 18 [among which the Upa-dvIpas are said to be included Naish. i , 5 Sch.] ; they are situated round the mountain Meru , and separated from each other by distinct concentric circumambient oceans ; ayaM dvIpaH = jambu-dv... BhP. v , 16 , 5 or = bhArata-dv... VP. ii , 3 , 7) 507,1 L=99005
